description: The Justice Department accused three Iranian operatives of hacking into the Trump campaign and stealing documents. Officials said it was part of an effort by foreign governments to interfere in the presidential election. All three of those charged live in Iran and are likely out of reach of U.S. law enforcement. The Iranian government has denied involvement. NBC News' Ken Dilanian reports.
title: U.S. charges three Iranian operatives with hacking into Trump campaign

description: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu rejected criticism of Israel's war in Gaza and against Hezbollan in Lebanon at the United Nations General Assembly.
title: Netanyahu lashes out at U.N. as he defends Israel's actions in Gaza and Lebanon

description: Former President Trump held a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at Trump Tower in New York. Zelenskyy discussed how it was important for him to meet with both presidential candidates about continuing support for Ukraine after the November election.
title: Trump holds meeting with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu began his remarks at the United Nations General Assembly by saying he decided to attend and speak only after hearing what he claims were "lies and slanders" about Israel from other world leaders.
title: Netanyahu claims U.N. speakers leveled 'lies and slanders' against Israel

description: The streets around an area in southern Lebanon that was targeted by Israeli warplanes on Monday were eerily deserted Friday. NBC News' Richard Engel reports from the wreckage of a building that is still smoldering.
title: Richard Engel reports from Tyre, Lebanon, at a location recently bombed by Israel

description: More than 100 reporters have been killed in Gaza, according to the International Federation of Journalists. In addition to the threat to life, the media face crackdowns and restrictions. NBC News' Hala Gorani has an in-depth report about the journalists caught in the crossfire.
title: Gaza war journalists face unprecedented peril to report on the conflict

description: Chocolate-brown and fluffy, Pesto is a 9-month-old king penguin that weighs 52 pounds, more than twice the combined weight of his parents. He has drawn hundreds of visitors to an Australian aquarium and now the bird can count Katy Perry as one of his biggest fans.
title: Pesto the king penguin chick becomes an internet sensation

description: Chinese markets clocked their best week in almost 16 years as the mainland’s CSI 300 rallied 15.7% this week, buoyed by several economic stimulus measures by the central bank.
title: China stocks see best week since 2008 on stimulus impact as most Asia markets rise

description: Shigeru Ishiba is set to become Japan’s new prime minister after the governing Liberal Democratic Party elected him as its new leader on Friday.
title: Former defence minister set to lead Japan amid efforts to counter China's growing power
